meanings.definition: A solid-state semiconductor device with four layers of alternating N and P-type material, used as a switch or rectifier.
meanings.sent1: The thyristor controlled the flow of electricity in the circuit.
meanings.sent2: Engineers often use a thyristor in power control applications.
meanings.sent3: The thyristor walked into the circuit party and started switching things up!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a thyristor, directing her actions with precision.
meanings.sent5: The thyristor hummed with power, regulating the current effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A type of electronic component that can switch high currents and voltages.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to connect the thyristor correctly to handle high currents.
meanings.sent2: The thyristor is a crucial part of the power supply unit.
meanings.sent3: The thyristor decided to take a break from switching things and went on a voltage vacation.
meanings.sent4: In the storm of electricity, the thyristor stood strong, controlling the currents.
meanings.sent5: With a flick of the thyristor, the entire system sprang to life.
